pullRequest.body:
Main definitions:

- `separableClosure`: the (relative) separable closure of `E / F`, or called maximal separable subextension of `E / F`, is defined to be the intermediate field of `E / F` consisting of all separable elements.
- `Field.sepDegree F E`: the (infinite) separable degree `[E:F]_s` of an algebraic extension `E / F` of fields, defined to be the degree of `separableClosure F E / F`.
- `Field.insepDegree F E`: the (infinite) inseparable degree `[E:F]_i` of an algebraic extension `E / F` of fields, defined to be the degree of `E / separableClosure F E`.
- `Field.finInsepDegree F E`: the (finite) inseparable degree `[E:F]_i` of an algebraic extension `E / F` of fields, defined to be the degree of `E / separableClosure F E` as a natural number. It is zero if such field extension is not finite.

Main results:

- `le_separableClosure_iff`: an intermediate field of `E / F` is contained in the (relative) separable closure of `E / F` if and only if it is separable over `F`.
- `separableClosure.normalClosure_eq_self`: the normal closure of the (relative) separable closure of `E / F` is equal to itself.
- `separableClosure.normal`: the (relative) separable closure of a normal extension is normal.
- `separableClosure.isSepClosure`: the (relative) separable closure of a separably closed extension is a separable closure of the base field.
- `IntermediateField.isSeparable_adjoin_iff_separable`: `F(S) / F` is a separable extension if and only if all elements of `S` are separable elements.
- `separableClosure.eq_top_iff`: the (relative) separable closure of `E / F` is equal to `E` if and only if `E / F` is separable.

---

Thanks ðŸŽ‰ 
maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

(untested)
```suggestion
  one_mem' := map_one (algebraMap F E) â–¸ separable_algebraMap F E 1
  add_mem' := separable_add F E
  zero_mem' := map_zero (algebraMap F E) â–¸ separable_algebraMap F E 0
```
by the way, it seems to me that `E` doesn't need to be explicit in `separable_mul/add/inv`.
We have [IntermediateField.map_le_iff_le_comap](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/IntermediateField.html#IntermediateField.map_le_iff_le_comap)

(untested)
```suggestion
  let i' : separableClosure F E â‰ƒâ‚[F] i.fieldRange := AlgEquiv.ofInjectiveField i
```
This can actually be inlined if you want

Can you add some API around this or at least add a todo?
For example (restating) that `IsGalois F (SeparableClosure F)`
Or the fact that every separable extension embeds into it.

> Can you add some API around this or at least add a todo?

Ideally all the APIs of separable closed extension and (absolute) separable closure should be added to `IsSepClosed.lean`.

> For example (restating) that `IsGalois F (SeparableClosure F)`

This can by synth automatically from the coming `separableClosure.isGalois` (or from `IsSepClosure.isGalois`).

> Or the fact that every separable extension embeds into it.

This is [IsSepClosed.lift](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/IsSepClosed.html#IsSepClosed.lift).
I see. Is the instance `IsSepClosure (SeparableClosure F)` coming in this PR?
I found it. Thanks for the updated docstring.
Should we upgrade this to `IsGalois F (separableClosure F E)`?

Can you provide a version of this without `lift`?
Then `sepDegree_bot` won't need those rewrites for example.
Sure. But `sepDegree_bot` still needs the rewrites since `F` and `âŠ¥` are not in the same universe ðŸ˜‚
same for this
I wonder if `finrank (separableClosure F E) E` will be easier to work with? (it is definitionally the same)

It's easier to `rw [finrank]` than `rw [â† finrank]` so indeed it's probably a good idea to use `finrank` as the def. If we keep the current def:
```suggestion
def finInsepDegree : â„• := (insepDegree F E).toNat
```

> I wonder if `finrank (separableClosure F E) E` will be easier to work with? (it is definitionally the same)

This change breaks some of the following proofs using `simp only`.

>  Suggested change
```lean
- def finInsepDegree : â„• := Cardinal.toNat (insepDegree F E)
+ def finInsepDegree : â„• := (insepDegree F E).toNat
```

Unfortunately this doesn't work:
```
invalid field notation, function 'Cardinal.toNat' does not have argument with type
(Cardinal ...) that can be used, it must be explicit or implicit with a unique name
```

I see, .toNat is a bundled ZeroHom. (Is it not a MonoidHom?) The CoeFun symbol no longer show up in the docs, which confused me.
(Update: there's [Cardinal.toNatHom](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/SetTheory/Cardinal/Basic.html#Cardinal.toNatHom) which is a MonoidWithZeroHom so I see no reason not to make Cardinal.toNat just a plain function.)

I'd suppose `finrank` has some more lemmas around it? You can add `finrank` to the `simp only`s to fix them if that is the only concern. Otherwise adding the equality as a rfl lemma might be useful as well.

> I'd suppose `finrank` has some more lemmas around it? You can add `finrank` to the `simp only`s to fix them if that is the only concern. Otherwise adding the equality as a rfl lemma might be useful as well.

Let me try later.

You write `separableClosure F E` without the parentheses in the [module docstring](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9338/files#diff-fbae6aa6a45b5781c17dc0397d1edfbcf1ed608887c0c6aa87cf2f0a57d44145R24-R34) but use parentheses here. (I think they're not needed.)
Maybe we should transport the Subalgebra Subsingleton instance to IntermediateField, so you can just `rw [Subsingleton.elim (separableClosure F F) âŠ¥`.

defeq manipulation before `exact` is almost always unnecessary. `.toAlgHom` are unnecessary too.
```suggestion
    separableClosure F K = (separableClosure F E).map i := by
  refine le_antisymm (fun x hx â†¦ ?_) (map_le_of_algHom F E K i)
  exact âŸ¨i.symm x, (map_mem_separableClosure_iff F K E i.symm).2 hx, i.right_inv xâŸ©
```
(`i.symm x` can be omitted too)
(`apply_symm_apply` works better for rewrites, but `right_inv` is the same definitionally.)

uses `map_mem_separableClosure_iff`
```suggestion
  obtain âŸ¨y, rflâŸ© := mem_bot.1 <| h â–¸ (mem_separableClosure_iff E K).2
    (mem_separableClosure_iff _ _ |>.mp hx |>.map_minpoly E)
  exact âŸ¨y, (map_mem_separableClosure_iff _ _ _ <| IsScalarTower.toAlgHom F E K).mp hx, rflâŸ©
```

```suggestion
  âŸ¨fun h â†¦ âŸ¨fun x â†¦ by simpa only [minpoly_eq] using h x.2âŸ©, fun _ â†¦ le_separableClosure _ _ _âŸ©
```

I think we should extract from the proof of `IsSeparable.trans` the lemma that `(minpoly L x).Separable` and `IsSeparable F L` implies `(minpoly F x).Separable`. That would also make the proof of `eq_restrictScalars_of_isSeparable` just one line.

```suggestion
  âŸ¨fun h â†¦ âŸ¨fun _ â†¦ (mem_separableClosure_iff F E).1 (h â–¸ mem_top)âŸ©,
    fun _ â†¦ top_unique fun x _ â†¦ (mem_separableClosure_iff F E).2 (IsSeparable.separable _ x)âŸ©
```

```suggestion
    IsSeparable F (adjoin F S) â†” âˆ€ x âˆˆ S, (minpoly F x).Separable :=
  (le_separableClosure_iff F E _).symm.trans adjoin_le_iff
```

```suggestion
    separableClosure F K â‰¤ (separableClosure E K).restrictScalars F :=
  fun _ hx â†¦ hx.map_minpoly E
```

```suggestion
  Algebra.lift_rank_eq_of_equiv_equiv (separableClosure.algEquivOfAlgEquiv F E K i) i rfl
```
I think you can put `mul/add/inv` together and use a single `variable {F E}` (without `in`) for them, and then `variable (E)` at the end for `algebraMap` alone.

I'd like to add
```
theorem IsSepClosed.separableClosure_eq_bot [IsSepClosed F] : separableClosure F E = âŠ¥ :=
  bot_unique fun x hx â†¦ mem_bot.2 <|
    have âŸ¨y, hyâŸ© := IsSepClosed.algebraMap_surjective (âŸ¨x, hxâŸ© : separableClosure F E)
    âŸ¨y, Subtype.ext_iff.mp hyâŸ©
```
here; it would be nice to add the IsAlgClosed version as well using `integralClosure` or my `IntermediateField.algClosure` that hasn't been PR'd ... (notice that [IsIntegrallyClosed.integralClosure_eq_bot](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/IntegrallyClosed.html#IsIntegrallyClosed.integralClosure_eq_bot) says something different, because IsIntegrallyClosed is restricted to the FractionRing.)
More generally, if `IsSepClosed F`, `L : IntermediateField F E` and `IsSeparable F L`, then `L = âŠ¥`. Then `separableClosure F E = âŠ¥` should comes automatically.

I plan to add `IntermediateField.eq_bot_of_isSepClosed_of_isSeparable` in `IsSepClosed.lean`. Would you like to add a similar result to `IsAlgClosed.lean`?

[EDIT] Oh, but `separableClosure.separableClosure_eq_bot` is not a corollary of it, since `separableClosure F E` in general is not `IsSepClosed` ðŸ˜…

> I plan to add IntermediateField.eq_bot_of_isSepClosed_of_isSeparable in IsSepClosed.lean.

Sounds good, thanks for the generalization!

> Would you like to add a similar result to IsAlgClosed.lean?

That would be nice, yes. I just think you might face some difficulties without an `IntermediateField` version of `integralClosure`.

> Oh, but separableClosure.separableClosure_eq_bot is not a corollary of it, since separableClosure F E in general is not IsSepClosed ðŸ˜…

Yeah, they don't imply each other but the statements are similar, so it's a good idea to place them together. My version is used to prove `IsSepClosed.separableClosure_eq_bot_iff` below.

Now this code works:
```lean
example [IsSepClosed F] : separableClosure F E = âŠ¥ := by
  exact eq_bot_of_isSepClosed_of_isSeparable _
```
but `exact?` can't find `eq_bot_of_isSepClosed_of_isSeparable `, I don't know why.
I think F and E need not be explicit. You might try to optimize other ones a bit too.

If you add
```
lemma IsSepClosed.separableClosure_eq_bot_iff [IsSepClosed E] :
    separableClosure F E = âŠ¥ â†” IsSepClosed F := by
  refine âŸ¨fun h â†¦ IsSepClosed.of_exists_root _ fun p _ hirr hsep â†¦ ?_,
    fun _ â†¦ IsSepClosed.separableClosure_eq_bot F EâŸ©
  obtain âŸ¨x, hxâŸ© := IsSepClosed.exists_aeval_eq_zero E p (degree_pos_of_irreducible hirr).ne' hsep
  obtain âŸ¨x, rflâŸ© := h â–¸ (mem_separableClosure_iff F E).mpr (hsep.of_dvd <| minpoly.dvd _ x hx)
  exact âŸ¨x, by simpa [Algebra.ofId_apply] using hxâŸ©
```
then this proof becomes:
```suggestion
/-- If `E` is separably closed, then the (relative) separable closure of `E / F` is a
separable closure of `F`. -/
instance separableClosure.isSepClosure [IsSepClosed E] : IsSepClosure F (separableClosure F E) :=
  âŸ¨(IsSepClosed.separableClosure_eq_bot_iff _ E).mp (separableClosure.separableClosure_eq_bot F E),
    isSeparable F EâŸ©
```
